Package ohos.ai.cv.sr

Interface IImageSuperResolution

  • All Superinterfaces:
    ICvBase

    public interface IImageSuperResolution
extends ICvBase
    Provides the single image super-resolution (SISR) function.

    For a 1x scale factor, SISR uses intelligent methods to suppress the compression noise of a given image to make it clearer. For a 3x scale factor, SISR uses intelligent methods to magnify a given image by a factor of 3 to enhance its resolution, and identifies and suppresses the compression noise to obtain clearer details and textures than traditional magnification.

    This interface performs super-resolution on an input image, generates an output image, and returns the result code of super-resolution processing.

    This interface provides two process modes. The MODE_IN mode indicates that the SDK directly invokes the SISR function in the caller process. The MODE_OUT mode indicates that the SDK functions as a client to send a calling request to the HUAWEI HiAI Engine, which performs SISR and returns the result to the caller.

    This interface also provides two block modes. In synchronous mode, the calling is blocked in the doSuperResolution method until the super-resolution processing is complete. In asynchronous mode, the doSuperResolution method is returned immediately, and the super-resolution processing result is returned to the caller in callback mode.

    Since:
    1

    • Method Detail

      • doSuperResolution

        int doSuperResolution​(VisionImage image,
                      ImageResult result,
                      VisionCallback<ImageResult> visionCallback)
        Performs SISR on an image and returns the result code.
        Parameters:
        image - Indicates an input image.
        result - Indicates the image after SISR in synchronous mode.
        visionCallback - Indicates the callback class to use.
        • If this parameter is null, doSuperResolution is called synchronously, and the image after super-resolution is output from the result parameter.
        • If this parameter is not null, doSuperResolution is called asynchronously, and the result parameter should be null. When the asynchronous call is successful, the image after super-resolution can be obtained from onResult, or an error code is passed from onError.
        Returns:
        Returns HwHiAIResultCode.AIRESULT_SUCCESS if the synchronous call is successful; returns an error code otherwise.

        Returns HwHiAIResultCode.AIRESULT_ASYNC_MODE if the asynchronous call is successful; returns an error code if any input parameter is invalid.

        For more information, see HwHiAIResultCode.

        Since:
        1

      • setVisionConfiguration

        void setVisionConfiguration​(SisrConfiguration config)
        Sets the SISR parameter.

        If this method is not called or the input parameter SisrConfiguration is set to null, the default super-resolution scale factor 1x is used.

        Parameters:
        config - Indicates the SISR parameter, SisrConfiguration.
        Since:
        1
